org.xflatdb.xflat.convert

Interface ConversionService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultConversionService

    public interface ConversionService
    Provides conversions from one POJO to another. Modeled after Spring's conversion service, but I saw no need to import spring framework's core to perform the simple conversions. Copied from org.springframework.core.convert, modified by Gordon Burgett

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <S,T> void addConverter(java.lang.Class<S> sourceType, java.lang.Class<T> targetType, Converter<? super S,? extends T> converter)
      Adds a converter to the conversion service.
      boolean canConvert(java.lang.Class<?> source, java.lang.Class<?> target)
      Returns true if objects of sourceType can be converted to targetType.
      <T> T convert(java.lang.Object source, java.lang.Class<T> target)
      Convert the source to targetType.
      void removeConverter(java.lang.Class<?> sourceType, java.lang.Class<?> targetType)
      Removes the registered converter for the source to target type.

    • Method Detail

      • canConvert

        boolean canConvert(java.lang.Class<?> source,
                 java.lang.Class<?> target)
        Returns true if objects of sourceType can be converted to targetType. If this method returns true, it means convert(Object, Class) is capable of converting an instance of sourceType to targetType.
        Parameters:
        source - the source type to convert from (may be null if source is null)
        target - the target type to convert to (required)
        Returns:
        true if the conversion service has a conversion from the source to the target.

      • convert

        <T> T convert(java.lang.Object source,
            java.lang.Class<T> target)
          throws ConversionException
        Convert the source to targetType.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        source - the source object to convert (may be null)
        target - the target type to convert to (required)
        Returns:
        the converted object, an instance of targetType
        Throws:
        ConversionException - if there is an error during conversion
        ConversionNotSupportedException - if the conversion is not supported according to canConvert(java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class).

      • addConverter

        <S,T> void addConverter(java.lang.Class<S> sourceType,
                      java.lang.Class<T> targetType,
                      Converter<? super S,? extends T> converter)
        Adds a converter to the conversion service.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        T -
        Parameters:
        sourceType - The type of objects that the converter converts from.
        targetType - The type of objects that the converter converts to.
        converter - The converter that performs the conversion.

      • removeConverter

        void removeConverter(java.lang.Class<?> sourceType,
                   java.lang.Class<?> targetType)
        Removes the registered converter for the source to target type.
        Parameters:
        sourceType - The source type to convert from
        targetType - The target type to convert to
